poem:
### Carving Shadows

No detente's dawn yet,  
whispers of border brushes—  
razor-edged maps  
over earth's tender flesh.  
Strasbourg sighs, autumn chills;  
voices rise against the drift.  
A sovereign skin,  
stitched by strife,  
pleads for peace—  
not pieces.  
In fields where wheat  
cowers, we sow tears,  
time's ticking echoes:  
boundaries, unbound.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Von der Leyen warns against ‘carving up’ of Ukraine amid crunch US-led talks The European Commission president, Ursula von der Leyen, has warned against “the unilateral carving up of a sovereign European nation”, as Europe scrambles to assert influence over a US effort to end the war in Ukraine. Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
